reference: Feldstein, Martin. 1973. "The Welfare Loss of Excess Health Insurance," Journal of Political Economy. Vol 81, No. 2. Part 1. March-April 1973. Feldstein, Martin. 1981a. "Hospital Costs and Health Insurance," Cambridge: Harvard University Press. 1981. Feldstein, Martin. 1981b. Budget Policy without Fine Tuning. Wall Street Journal. March 12, 1981.
Feldstein, Martin. 1981c. The Tax Cut: Why the Market Dropped," Wall Street Journal. November 11, 1981.
Feldstein, Martin. 1984. " '85 is the Year to Correct the Imbalance," New York Times. November 18, 1984.
Feldstein, Martin. 1989. "FSLIC Funding Belongs Off-Budget," Wall Street Journal. March 1, 1989.
Feldstein, Martin. 1993. "Tax Policy in the 1980s: A Personal View." NBER Working Paper.

Feldstein, Martin and E. Allison. 1974. "Tax Subsidies of Private Health Insurance: Distribution, Revenue Loss and Effects," The Economics of Federal Subsidy Programs. Joint Economic Committee. U.S. Congress, Washington, D.C. July 1974.
Feldstein, Martin and B. Friedman. 1977. "Tax Subsidies, the Rational Demand for Insurance and the Health Care Crisis," Journal of Public Economics. 1977.
Feldstein, Martin and C. Horioka. 1980. "Domestic Savings and International Capital Flows." The 1979 W.A. Mackintosh Lecture at Queen's University. Economic Journal. 1980.
